mainEntity.name: How do I calculate asphalt tonnage for a driveway?

acceptedAnswer.text: To calculate asphalt tonnage: 1) Measure length x width for square footage 2) Multiply by depth (inches) 3) Multiply by 145 lbs/sq ft/inch 4) Divide by 2000 for tons. For most driveways, plan for 2-3 inches depth.

mainEntity.name: How do I calculate gravel for a driveway?

acceptedAnswer.text: Calculate gravel needed by: 1) Measuring length x width for square footage 2) Multiply by desired depth (typically 4 inches or 0.33 feet) 3) Divide by 27 to get cubic yards 4) Add 10% for compaction.

mainEntity.name: What is the cost difference between concrete and asphalt driveways?

acceptedAnswer.text: Concrete driveways typically cost $4-8 per square foot while asphalt averages $2-6 per square foot. Though concrete costs more initially, it often lasts longer with proper maintenance.
